alert.note: Alert for Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: High Surf Warning issued May 26 at 7:49AM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...A HIGH SURF WARNING IS NOW IN EFFECT... WHAT...Surf heights of 13 to 16 feet WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands WHEN...Through today Lapataiga mo galu matua maualuluga Ofisa o le tau Pago Pago AS 749 TAEAO ASO FARAILE ME 26 2023 ...Ua iai nei le Lapataiga mo Galu maualuluga... MAFUAAGA...O galu maualuluga e 13 i le 16 futu NOFOAGA...Talafatai i saute ma sasa`e o motu uma TAIMI...mo le aso FAUTUAGA/TAPENAGA... O lapataiga mo galu maualuluga e faailoa mai ai le malolosi ma le tetele o galu o le a aafia ai gatafale ma matafaga, ma o le a malolosi aava o le sami e ono solo ai nisi o vaega o le matafaga. Faiva po o le ona o le siisii o tulaga o sami ma galu, e le tatau i le au fai mamalu lautele ona fagogota pe maimoa i galu. O i latou i le matafaga, e mafai ona maua faafuaseia e galu.
info.instruction: A high surf warning indicates dangerous large breaking waves will pound the shoreline in the warning area, producing deadly rip currents and localized beach erosion. Also, it is extremely dangerous to fish or observe waves from rocks during high surf conditions. Unwary beach walkers can be caught off guard as waves suddenly race farther up the beach than normal.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
